direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve canceling transactions, but shutDown cancels all transactions while cancelTransaction cancels a specific one.
Both methods involve removing transactions from a collection, but shutDown removes all while removeClientTransaction removes a specific one.
Both methods involve removing transactions from a collection, but shutDown removes all while removeServerTransaction removes a specific one.
Both methods involve stopping operations, but shutDown stops all operations while stop() stops a specific component (NetAccessManager).

enhanced_by.reason: Both methods require initialization of components before performing their main operations.
Both methods require setting up the environment before performing their main operations.
Both methods involve verifying the format of data and handling exceptions similarly.
